intro: Pagamea capitata, commonly known as the Cape barbet or Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Pagamea capitata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
